meanings.definition: To guide or lead someone or something back to a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was reconducting the lost student to the classroom.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost in the park, she reconducts herself to the main entrance.
meanings.sent3: The confused puppy kept reconducting the ball to the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts reconduct to the peaceful beach where she felt at ease.
meanings.sent5: The map reconducts you to the starting point of the hiking trail.

meanings.definition: To organize or carry out an event or activity again.
meanings.sent1: They are reconducting the charity event to raise more funds.
meanings.sent2: Due to the rain, they had to reconduct the outdoor concert indoors.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to reconduct his disappearing act for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The team captain reconducts the team meeting to discuss the new strategy.
meanings.sent5: The chef will reconduct the cooking class for those who missed it last week.

meanings.definition: To direct or manage a process or situation again.
meanings.sent1: The supervisor is reconducting the safety training for all employees.
meanings.sent2: The coach decided to reconduct the practice session to improve teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to reconduct the investigation after new evidence surfaced.
meanings.sent4: The CEO reconducts the quarterly meeting to address the company's performance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reconducts the experiment to ensure accurate results.
